channel.title: Comments on: HOWTO: Very low power usage on Pro Mini V2 (Arduino clone)

item.title: By: Mr-detail
item.dc:creator: Mr-detail
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2015/06/11/howto-very-low-power-usage-on-pro-mini-v2-arduino-clone/#comment-69">Arduino power consumption and management | Raspberries and other fruits</a>.
Nice article man. Just in case anyone is reading this and did what I did first. My arduino came as the 5v version with the 5v tab soldered. I removed the power led and the regulator, used the rocket scream low power library only to find it dropped to 2.7mA ~ 2.8mA range. Do what this guy says, its way easier to un-solder the 3.3v/5v adjustment solder tab. If you don't, you lose about 2.7mA to the resistor network that was used by the regulator!
Thanks for saving me from banging my head against the wall for a couple more hours!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Arduino power consumption and management | Raspberries and other fruits.

Nice article man. Just in case anyone is reading this and did what I did first. My arduino came as the 5v version with the 5v tab soldered. I removed the power led and the regulator, used the rocket scream low power library only to find it dropped to 2.7mA ~ 2.8mA range. Do what this guy says, its way easier to un-solder the 3.3v/5v adjustment solder tab. If you don’t, you lose about 2.7mA to the resistor network that was used by the regulator!

Thanks for saving me from banging my head against the wall for a couple more hours!

item.title: By: Stergios
item.dc:creator: Stergios
item.description:
I found better way to stop the led to light. As we know, led can't be powered directly from battery...because... are burned.... That's it!
Place very carefully the wires of a battery (3v) on led corners. Don't expect to see anything. Power the arduino pro mini to check if you have done. Led never lights again!!
item.content:encoded:
I found better way to stop the led to light.
As we know, led can’t be powered directly from battery…because… are burned….
That’s it!

Place very carefully the wires of a battery (3v) on led corners. Don’t expect to see anything.
Power the arduino pro mini to check if you have done.
Led never lights again!!
